summary: This is an email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York dated January 10, 2020, summarizing clarifications provided by a witness (likely Ghislaine Maxwell) regarding her previous statements. The clarifications cover details about her marriage, interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, financial matters, legal representation, and specific allegations about activities on Epstein's island.

persons.name: Noah
persons.context: Mentioned as the husband of the witness, with a clarification that he was 23 (not 22) when they married while she was 17.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure discussed; clarifications involve his instructions to dispose of evidence in Palm Beach, a 2018 meeting in New York about finances, his knowledge of media inquiries, and his control over the witness's legal representation and access to his properties.

persons.name: Johnny Stevenson
persons.context: Mentioned phonetically; prior to him, the witness had legal counsel chosen by Epstein. He is noted in the context of the witness's legal representation history.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the email, working in the Southern District of New York, who is documenting clarifications from a witness.

connections.description: Clarification that they were married when she was 17 and he was 23.
The witness received instructions from Epstein, communicated with him about finances and media inquiries, and had her legal representation initially controlled by him.
Johnny Stevenson represented the witness in legal cases, marking the first time she had her own legal representation separate from Epstein's choices.

events.title: Meeting with Epstein in New York
events.description: A meeting between the witness and Jeffrey Epstein in New York to discuss financial issues.

events.title: Planned deposition that did not occur
events.description: The witness was supposed to be deposed in November 2018 in a case, but believes the case settled before that happened.

events.title: Tax reporting clarification
events.description: Discussion about reporting Epstein's payments on the witness's taxes, with reference to a conversation with an accountant prior to the 2019 tax returns.

keyFacts: The witness clarified that her husband Noah was 23 (not 22) when they married while she was 17.
The witness recalls Epstein instructing her to get rid of computers in Palm Beach, but is less clear about instructions regarding directories and photos.
Epstein was aware of media inquiries from the Herald in April and November, as the witness had raised this with him.
The witness's first independent legal representation was for the VR case, after which the same attorney represented her in another case; prior to that, her counsel was chosen by Epstein.

A specific allegation is clarified: regarding GM (likely Ghislaine Maxwell), she directed women to be wrapped in saran-wrap, and there was always a massage table outside on the island, not brought out just for a photo shoot.
